thread.title_full: CA's Profit Falls Sharply on Impact of Stronger U.S. Dollar

author: morningstar.com
title: CA's Profit Falls Sharply on Impact of Stronger U.S. Dollar
text:
By Maria Armental
CA Inc.'s second-quarter profit fell sharply as the software vendor continued to struggle with a stronger U.S. dollar.
While based in the U.S., about a third of its revenue is made abroad.
Based on the projected impact of currency conversion, CA now projects annual profit of $2.34 to $2.40 a share on $4 billion to $4.04 billion in revenue, compared with its previous view of $2.37 to $2.44 a share in earnings on $4.04 billion to $4.11 billion in revenue.
Last year, it posted a profit, excluding items, of $2.53 a share on $4.26 billion in revenue.
Also known CA Technologies, the former Computer Associates makes software for mainframe computers and other hardware. The Islandia, N.Y., company has been shedding noncore businesses to focus operations on management cloud, application development and operations, and security.
Over all, CA reported a profit of $174 million, or 39 cents a share, compared with $256 million, or 58 cents a share, a year earlier. Excluding stock-based compensation and other items, profit from continuing operations fell to 56 cents a share from 65 cents a year earlier.
Revenue declined nearly 7% to $1.01 billion. Adjusted for currency impacts, revenue dropped 1%, CA said.
Analysts surveyed by Thomson Reuters had projected profit of 56 cents a share on $1.01 billion in revenue.
Excluding currency impacts, the company's bookings rose 92%, with bookings in North America more than doubling compared with the year earlier largely tied to one contract, CA said.
While revenue accounts for payments collected during the quarter, bookings reflect the value of software fees and subscription, maintenance and other contracts customers signed during the quarter but that the company will collect over time. Technology companies, in particular, increasingly rely on bookings to give investors a long-term view of projected revenue.
Shares, largely inactive in late trading, closed at $27.71 on Wednesday, down 9% for the year.
